l2d.title: L2D Agency
l2d.projectDescription: L2D's website features a portfolio of their recent work.

mainImage.caption: The L2D Logo is displayed inside a custom ThreeJS script generated from live video feed data.

content.article: The L2D website reflects a portfolio of work on built into a single page. The custom-built SPA features Greensock animations and transitions. L2D's website features reactivity based on scroll events. L2D also features inline forms validated through native JavaScript and styled with custom SCSS. Each project is loaded dynamically from custom structured data.

images.caption: The contact information is displayed along side the contact form.
The project grid contains advanced SCSS styles to display a dropshadow on hover.
The ThreeJS script displays translated video in a 3d pattern with alternative styles.
The forms are styled with parallaxed background images. The forms are validated through native JavaScript.
The L2D website is responsive and functions across a range of devices.
If no one is at the office, the ThreeJS script remains fairly static.
The ThreeJS script works cross-device, even on mobile.
The menu opens with a dramatic animation over client logos. Meanwhile, other elements move parralax to the background.
The top of the page can be expanded into a dashboard allowing interaction with the L2D employees as they work. Catch them at the right time, they might wave, "Hello!"
Client logos are loaded as the user scrolls towards more content. Once loaded, the logos are animated in with the Greensock animation library.
Projects are displayed in a flexible grid with corresponding icons and custom animations.

sos.title: Safe Online Surfing
sos.projectDescription: SOS features educational games built with HTML5, JavaScript, and CSS. SOS supports legacy browsers, including IE9.

mainImage.caption: A player's character answers questions in order to avoid obstacles while surfing.

content.article: SOS is built with sessionStorage to track users' data. User data is applied via game-state to track interaction. SOS leverages CSS transitions rather than JavaScript animation. SOS supports deprecated browsers such as IE9! The companion NodeJS project allows language translation.

images.caption: SOS's landing page displays all critical information in a highly visible UI. Students can choose which grade-level character to play as.

Students must collect all of the hidden coins. Student users must answer a challenge question once a coin is revealed. The coin is collected if the student's answer is correct. The health bar displays the game's status.
Line up the board walk to create a path across to the other beach.
Each grade-level has a different island theme with a unique playable character.
Students must answer questions during the games in order to successfully finish.
Questions can be formatted in several ways while using the same general structure and CSS class names.
Each grade-level island contains several themed challenges.
Students must keep their character's computer healthy by responding to a series of questions.
A surfing character successfully dodges an obstacle after a correct answer.
A congratulations screen after successfully completing a challenge.
The island can be configured with placed markers. The markers are numbered and mapped as an individual game.
To complete this game a user must unlock all the locked spaces.
This modal presents information about the general contest in order to keep the user's educators informed.
Users are presented with a set of instructions for completing each separate contest.
The student must match the word with the definition.
The difficulty of the contest is dependent upon grade level.
View of a successful completion of the surfing game before the final screen.

rtc.title: Ringgold Telecommunications Company
rtc.projectDescription: A telecommunications provider website built with Foundation and Craft.

content.article: A proven front-end reliable enough for customers to gain access to essential services. Special attention was paid to accessibility and performance tests. RTC was built to serve the general public with a sleek and stylish performance.

images.caption: RTC uses parallaxing elements to emphasize promotional graphics in a two-column responsive layout.
RTC features several animations, including a ThreeJS wave and a throttled SVG animation.
The desktop layout features custom styled elements. The YouTube video is progressivly lazy-loaded and then animated in.
Responsive view of the header content.
The home page features a header hierarchy with header text, tagline and button.
The desktop home page features ThreeJS animations.
RTC features completely custom and styled forms. The forms use native JavaScript along with server-side validation.
The slider features unique content in a responsive format.
A CSS animated chart displaying compared internet speeds.
An interior page featuring a video using the YouTube JavaScript API.
The footer is highly flexible and utilizes list styling.
Interior page headers include movies that autoplay on mobile and desktop.
RTC users can easily connect by using styled forms along with native validation.
All interior content is created within a template driven CMS.

crg.title: Chattanooga Roller Girls
crg.projectDescription: A Wordpress site built from the Foundation Sites framework

mainImage.caption: The mascot of CRG skates forward while the website loads.

content.article: This custom Wordpress theme for the Chattanooga WFTDA Roller Derby features several custom plugins. Advanced User Roles, Custom Categories, Custom Types, Google Analytics... the works! The theme was developed from the ground-up to be versatile. The theme features smooth page transitions for a seamless experience through JavaScript requests.

images.caption: The team mascot skates by while the data loads.
Individual skater pages are presented in a slider which tracks the user's page history via the HTML5 HistoryAPI.
The next home bouts are displayed front and center, even on odd sized devices.
An individual's skater page takes up more of the frame on a mobile device.
The schedule page is a similar layout to the homepage so that users are presented information in a manner that feels familiar.
CRG connects to the live Instagram feed ensuring always current content.
Coaches and staff are also displayed in a responsive format.
Skater's are presented in pairs on mobile devices.
The logo and animation are made using SVG and performant CSS animations.
When switching between interior views, the template transitions smoothly while briefly displaying a small loading animation.
Sponsors are laid out in a responsive grid fixed to an intrinsic ratio.
CRG's custom Wordpress theme uses custom data and logic to present the season's schedule.
CRG's home page view on a desktop PC.
CRG's page content is still readable even on tiny devices!
The Instagram API allows the most current team photos to be displayed.
The home page desktop view displays a banner.
The home page mobile view displays a banner.
On mobile devices, the hamburger menu expands to reveal an off-screen menu.

buntin.title: Buntin Media Group
buntin.projectDescription: The creative advertising agency's responsive unique website was built using VueJS.

mainImage.caption: The Buntin logo is presented while the unique experience loads.

images.caption: The parallaxing content enters the screen while the user scrolls.
The Adhope page displays a headline and logos on desktop.
A grid of portfolio images are presented on the client page.
Each agency card fits within all mobile devices.
A poster series for multiple years presented in a responsive slider with progressive loading.
While hovering, the main content section reveals a CTA moving in a 3D space.
The Buntin logo is presented on the first page load.
The infomation box is expanded from the info button on the agency's history page.
The loading screen is displayed before the entire experience.
Informational cards for each employee stagger in from top to bottom as the page loads.
The home page on desktop plays a video in the background.
The home page on mobile is very flexible and can respond to any size.
The home page presents a powerful video and entices the user to scroll down with a clickable button.
The menu opens to reveal an entire screen and a map via the Google Maps API.
The footer also displays a reusable card component, used on the home page just below the image slider.
A grid of logos which displays SVGs in a waterfall animation.
The contact page is the last station in the main view.
A navigation bar is displayed below the section headers and accompanying paragraph text.
The interior view shows a header image and title along with left and right arrows advancing users between the section content.
Floating information boxes of logos and text tells a story.
A view of the history page on desktop.
Users can scroll through entire sections presented as cards.
Each section is presented on a card delivered along a scrollable path.

drm.title: Deer Run Media
drm.projectDescription: Craft CMS template features a unique boutique video agency content.

mainImage.caption: Deer Run Media Logo
mainImage.alt: The logo is presented to users on the first load in a dramatic film-type presentation.

content.article: Deer Run Media, a local visual art and production company, shows off unique films while minimizing UI. Featuring a completely custom HTML5 video player this theme makes extensive use of the HTML5 Video API.

images.caption: The form uses a JavaScript API to POST forms.
Projects are presented in similar ways on desktop and mobile.
The contact page as viewed on a desktop PC.
The contact page on a mobile device.
The project page features a slider with flexible content. The slider's content may contain images or supporting film pieces.
The DRM logo on mobile.
DRM's images are presented on a mobile device.
An example project page as viewed on a mobile device.
The home page features interactive video segments that autoplay on mouse hover.
Some basic content is presented on an about page.
Case studies are presented in a grid format on desktop.
A view of the mobile home page with inline video.
